name: Miso Soup
ingredients: 1/2 sheet nori seaweed, cut into small pieces
cookingMethod:
1. In a saucepan, bring the dashi soup stock to a boil.
2. Add the cubed tofu to the soup.
3. Lower the heat to medium and simmer for a few minutes.
4. In a small bowl, dissolve the miso paste in a few tablespoons of the soup broth.
5. Turn off the heat and add the miso mixture to the soup.
6. Add the green onions and nori, and stir gently to combine.

name: Teriyaki Chicken
cookingMethod:
1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the chicken, skin side down, and cook until the skin is golden brown and crisp.
3. Turn the chicken over and add the sake, mirin, soy sauce, and sugar.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thickened and shiny.

name: Tempura Shrimp
cookingMethod:
1. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, egg yolk, and ice-cold water.
2. Heat the oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat.
3. Lightly salt the shrimp, then dip them in the batter to coat.
4. Fry the shrimp in the hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
5. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.
Shred cabbage and chop green onions.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, water, and eggs.
Mix in cabbage and green onions.
Heat vegetable oil in a pan and add batter.
Cook on both sides until golden brown.
Garnish with bonito flakes, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar.
Heat oil in a pan and add beef and onions.
Once beef is browned, add sauce mixture and water.
Beat eggs and pour over beef and onions.
Cover and let cook until eggs are set.

1. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and sake. Set aside.
2. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add the vegetable oil, then add the beef in a single layer. Cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, until browned.
3. Add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for another minute.
4. Pour in the soy sauce mixture and stir until the beef is coated.
5. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has thickened and the beef is cooked through.
6. Garnish with sliced green onions and serve over rice or noodles.

1. Preheat the oven to 400Â°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. Pound the chicken breasts to an even thickness. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Set up three shallow bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with panko breadcrumbs.
4. Dredge each chicken breast in the flour, shaking off any excess. Dip in the beaten eggs, then coat in the panko breadcrumbs.
5. Heat about 1/4 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken breasts for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy.
6. Transfer the chicken to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes, until cooked through.
7. Serve with tonkatsu sauce.
